channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bikes outside designated parking area, 9th October
item.description:
The number of Lime bikes and scooters opposite my home has increased over the last month or so. I already have problems with the frequent noise of the bikes being picked up and dropped off or stolen and now there are almost triple the number of bikes and scooters there should be. They’re also blocking parking spots and making it harder for cars to pass each other. Lime doesn’t respond to any problem reports.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hackford Road, Oval, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe pavement due to fallen fruit, 9th October
item.description:
There is a roadside apple tree which has dropped a huge amount of fruit all over the pavement and road making it very unsafe for pedestrians and also unsightly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beaumont Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 9th October
item.description:
Abandoned van, no registration plate. Been there a year. No action taken. Told parking warden, shrugged his shoulders and walked away. Reported this many times, no action taken!

item.title: Overflowing skip, 9th October
item.description:
A skip placed in front of 11 Hurley Crescent has been left overflowing for over 3 months. Winds blow away the rubbish ocassionally and it goes all over the nearby bushes, trees and along the street. Some of the rubbish has fallen and sits around the skip. The skip attracts wildlife, including foxes and rats and is becoming a health hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-13, Hurley Crescent, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
